description_short: Florence's Duomo anchors Ezio's Renaissance playground.
description_full: Exact cathedral in Florence used as Ezio's main landmark and freerunning hub, shown at true location and silhouette.

description_short: Bayek passes the rock-cut treasury and canyon approaches of Petra.
description_full: Hidden Ones DLC reuses Petra's Siq and treasury façade at their real coordinates; interior chambers are condensed for traversal.

description_short: Sacred peak forms a climbable summit in the Sinai expansion.
description_full: Summit and monastery sit on their real massif; paths are simplified but the ridgeline layout mirrors the historic pilgrimage site.

description_short: Capital on the Nile features Saqqara pyramids and temples.
description_full: City core sits south of modern Cairo where Memphis stood; districts are compressed but align to the real Saqqara necropolis belt.

description_short: Lush depression south of Memphis hosts crocodile cult villages.
description_full: Origins sets the lake, canals, and crocodile marshes at the true Faiyum depression; settlements are condensed along the Bahr Yussef canal.

description_short: Massive Ptolemaic temple anchors Edfu on the west bank.
description_full: Sanctuary stands at its real Nile-side footprint; interior passages are accessible but scaled to match gameplay while keeping pylons intact.

description_short: Island settlement features the Nilometer and granite quarries.
description_full: Origins places the Nilometer staircase and riverfront exactly on Elephantine; housing density is compressed to fit the explorable isle.

description_short: Labyrinthine palace ruins crown the hill above Heraklion.
description_full: Odyssey condenses the palace courtyards atop the real Kephala Hill site; frescoed chambers are stylized but follow the archaeological plan.

description_short: Sacred terraces and the Oracle sit on Parnassus' slopes.
description_full: Terraced temples follow the real switchback path up Mount Parnassus; the theater and treasury rows mirror their historical layout with minor compression.

description_short: The Hot Gates pass opens Odyssey's Leonidas flashback.
description_full: Narrow coastal defile is placed at the true Malian Gulf choke point; shoreline recession is minimized but terrain mirrors the historic pass.

description_short: Whitewashed harbor town hosts Spartan command in Odyssey.
description_full: Harbor sits on the real west coast bay with twin windmills; street grid is compacted but waterfront landmarks match the Cycladic port.

description_short: Kassandra returns to a fortified Naxos Town under Myrrine.
description_full: Settlement sits on the real northwest harbor; walls and palace are fictionalized, but coastline and port orientation mirror modern Naxos.

description_short: Samos' port town hides the mathematician's workshop.
description_full: Harbor city is placed on Samos' south coast at the real ancient port; tunnels and docks are compressed for traversal but follow the shoreline.

description_short: Clifftop Poseidon temple crowns Cape Sounion's promontory.
description_full: Odyssey places the Doric ruin exactly on the Sounion headland; columns are restored but the cape geography matches the real temple site.

description_short: Laconian capital sits beneath Taygetos in Odyssey's storyline.
description_full: City is placed on its real Eurotas River plateau; agora and training grounds are expanded but follow the genuine Spartan layout.

description_short: Isthmus city with the Acrocorinth fortress overlooks two seas.
description_full: Odyssey sets the fortified hill and lower city on the real isthmus; scale is reduced but harbor access and heights reflect the historic stronghold.

description_short: Assembly hill hosts Athenian debates above the city.
description_full: Speaker's platform and carved seating align to the real Pnyx; hillside is slightly widened for crowd scenes but matches the Acropolis vista.

description_short: Games complex with stadium and temples sits in the Alpheios valley.
description_full: Odyssey mirrors the sanctuary's footprint between rivers; stadium, temple rows, and Kronion hill match the real layout with reduced distances.

description_short: Lion Gate fortress crowns the Argolid hills in Odyssey.
description_full: Citadel sits on its true ridge with the Lion Gate and tholos tombs; walls are intact beyond ruins to support traversal but match the historic acropolis.

description_short: Oracle complex stands near the Milesian coast in Odyssey.
description_full: Sanctuary sits inland from the real Aegean shore; colossal columns are restored while the surrounding village is compressed around the temple court.

description_short: Wonder of the world appears as a restored cult center.
description_full: Temple is rebuilt on its genuine site near Selçuk; surrounding city blocks are compact, but orientation and approach roads match the ancient plan.

description_short: Steep hillside theater overlooks the valley below Pergamon.
description_full: Terraced acropolis and theater sit on the real Bergama hill; seating is slightly compressed but the vertiginous slope and view corridor are authentic.

description_short: Racing grounds host Templar ceremonies beside the Blue Mosque.
description_full: Oval plaza sits on its true Sarayburnu footprint with the obelisks; surrounding seats are truncated to fit Revelations' Istanbul hub size.

description_short: Sultan's palace anchors the Seraglio above the Bosporus.
description_full: Palace courts occupy the real Sarayburnu promontory; inner wards are simplified but gates and terraces reflect the historical complex.

description_short: Scholars' hall and library serve as Basim's knowledge hub.
description_full: Mirage places the academy within Baghdad's round city footprint; courtyards and observatories are fictionalized but sit on the historic Karkh bank.

description_short: The concentric core of Baghdad forms Mirage's central district.
description_full: Circular wall alignments match the historical Round City radius; districts and gates are compressed but the Tigris-side orientation is authentic.

description_short: Spiral minaret dominates the outskirts during a stealth mission.
description_full: Malwiya tower stands at its real Tigris-side coordinates; surrounding streets are fictionalized but the mosque courtyard reflects the historic plan.

description_short: Collapsed brick vault of Ctesiphon hides Assassin secrets.
description_full: Mirage places the monument on its true east-bank mound; adjoining palaces are stylized, but the soaring arch profile mirrors the real ruin.

description_short: Hidden Ones stronghold sits atop the Elburz range cliffs.
description_full: Fortress occupies the actual limestone spur; courtyards are extrapolated for gameplay but match the site's mountain eyrie location.

description_short: Rayonnant Gothic chapel glows on Île de la Cité.
description_full: Unity rebuilds the chapel at its real Palais de la Cité location; stained glass and spire are restored with slightly widened interior aisles.

description_short: Veterans' complex and gilded dome appear in Unity's Left Bank.
description_full: Cour d'honneur, dome church, and esplanade align with the real complex; surrounding streets are compressed but façades mirror the landmark.

description_short: Guillotine square anchors Unity's dramatic set pieces.
description_full: Plaza sits at its historical site between the Tuileries and Champs-Élysées; monuments are era-appropriate and scaled to fit crowd scenes.

description_short: Grand colonnaded museum hosts exhibits and infiltration routes.
description_full: Syndicate places the museum on its real Bloomsbury block with a reduced footprint; facade and courtyard mirror the neoclassical landmark.

description_short: Iron-and-glass exhibition hall appears in the Lambeth Dreadful Crimes arc.
description_full: Glass behemoth is placed in its post-1854 Sydenham Park setting; interior galleries are truncated but the hilltop footprint follows the historic rebuild.

description_short: Eivor climbs the crumbling Roman wall above Northumbria.
description_full: Wall segments follow the real east-west line with Housesteads perched on the ridge; scale is reduced but vallum and milecastle placements echo reality.

description_short: Holy Island monastery is raided during Valhalla's prologue.
description_full: Priory sits on Holy Island at its true shore; cloisters are opened up for combat but the tidal setting and ruins mirror the real monastery.

description_short: Viking-era York appears with Coppergate markets and cathedrals.
description_full: City sits on the Ouse at the real Roman grid; Minster and shambles are compressed but street orientations track historic York.

description_short: West Saxon capital with sprawling cathedral closes Eivor's arc.
description_full: Settlement sits on its real bend of the River Itchen; cathedral footprint is elongated but follows the historic nave and close arrangement.

description_short: Heavily guarded bank hosts stealth infiltrations in Syndicate.
description_full: Building occupies its real Threadneedle Street block; interior vaults are fictionalized, but exterior facades align to the neoclassical plan.

description_short: Prime Meridian hilltop hosts a vantage point over London.
description_full: Observatory sits in Greenwich Park at its true summit; building interiors are simplified but the meridian courtyard and viewshed match reality.

description_short: Norwegian harbor town opens Valhalla's snowy prologue.
description_full: Harbor basin sits on the real Byfjorden coast; settlement scale is reduced but shoreline contours mirror modern Stavanger's old town.

description_short: Cathedral town of Trondheim appears in Valhalla's Norway map.
description_full: City sits on the real Nidelva bend; cathedral footprint and fjord docks are compressed but oriented like historic Trondheim.

description_short: Viking port city anchors Wrath of the Druids' trade network.
description_full: Settlement sits at the River Liffey ford where Dublin formed; city walls and quays are condensed but mapped on the true medieval core.

description_short: Hilltop Laon and its six-towered cathedral feature in Siege of Paris DLC.
description_full: City is perched on its real limestone butte; cathedral dominates the crest with compressed streets wrapping the medieval walls.

description_short: Fortified city on the St. Lawrence serves as a Rogue hub.
description_full: Upper and Lower Towns follow Quebec's cliffside layout; walls and citadel are compressed but street orientations track the real colonial city.

description_short: Star fort and harbor form a key North Atlantic outpost.
description_full: Bastions guard the same Atlantic inlet as the historic fort; curtain walls are shortened but trace the real French fortress plan.

description_short: French colonial capital appears as a dense coastal port.
description_full: City sits on the real Gulf of Gonâve bay; street grid and forts are compressed but oriented to the peninsula harbor.

description_short: Harbor town with twin forts appears in Black Flag contracts.
description_full: Settlement sits on the real Caribbean bay; Castillo de Santiago and San Jerónimo are simplified but placed at their real headlands.

description_short: Hidden pirate refuge rests on the remote coral island.
description_full: Black Flag positions the cove on the real island's southwest shore; jungle interior is compressed but the crescent bay matches Providence's geography.

description_short: Atlantic staging port features wharves and steep lanes.
description_full: Town hugs the true Avalon Peninsula harbor; hills and fortifications are scaled down but follow the real coastal bowl of St. John's.

description_short: Strategic fork-of-the-rivers fort appears in AC3's frontier.
description_full: Star fort sits at the real confluence of the Allegheny and Monongahela; walls are simplified but placement matches the historic Point site.

description_short: Compressed but faithful recreation of Venice's St Mark's hub.
description_full: Central square and basilica rendered with reduced scale to fit the Venetian map while preserving key monuments and layout cues.

description_short: The Colosseum stands as Rome's climbable arena landmark.
description_full: Historical amphitheater appears at its real position with interior simplified for traversal, matching Renaissance ruins condition.

description_short: Jerusalem's sacred plateau anchors Altaïr's city routes.
description_full: Recreated holy compound scaled to fit the city map; recognizable Dome of the Rock serves as the skyline focus.

description_short: Fortified Crusader port controlling the coast.
description_full: Harbor district mirrors Akko's shoreline with compressed docks and walls to support stealth routes while retaining coastal orientation.

description_short: Crusader-era citadel crowns Damascus' Old City map.
description_full: Citadel placement matches the real fortress; interior routes are condensed but gatehouses and curtain walls follow historic plan.

description_short: Towering Pharos guides Bayek through Alexandria's harbor.
description_full: Reconstructed wonder based on historical accounts; full scale stylized to dramatize height while marking the real Pharos island site.

description_short: The Parthenon-topped Acropolis dominates Odyssey's Attika.
description_full: Sanctuary sits on its real limestone plateau with temples restored to classical form; scale slightly reduced for traversal.

description_short: Unity's painstaking Notre-Dame rebuild anchors Île de la Cité.
description_full: Cathedral modeled to near-laser accuracy with period-accurate spire; sits at exact coordinates as centerpiece of revolution-era Paris.

name_real: Her Majesty's Royal Palace and Fortress of the Tower of London
description_short: Victorian-era Tower serves as a fortified set piece in Syndicate.
description_full: Tower complex is geographically correct on the Thames with courtyard layouts simplified to support stealth missions and climbs.

name_real: Christ Church in the City of Boston
description_short: The steeple used for the lantern signal overlooks Revolution-era Boston.
description_full: Historic church appears at its authentic North End address; surrounding streets are compressed but building orientation matches reality.

name_real: Cathedral Basilica of the Virgin Mary of the Immaculate Conception
description_short: Baroque cathedral anchors Havana's pirate-era plaza.
description_full: Cathedral square mirrors the real site with facades simplified and street grid narrowed to keep traversal dense while preserving bay orientation.

name_real: Cathedral Church of the Holy Trinity, Saint Peter, Saint Paul and Saint Swithun
description_short: Valhalla depicts Winchester's cathedral as the Wessex power seat.
description_full: Medieval cathedral occupies its real site but city map compresses streets and cloisters into a stylized Anglo-Saxon core.

description_short: Iconic domed basilica towers over Ezio's Constantinople skyline.
description_full: Historic Hagia Sophia is placed at its true Sarayburnu site with minarets; interior is simplified but footprint mirrors the real monument.

description_short: Medieval Genoese tower dominates the northern bank climbing routes.
description_full: Tower sits at its true hilltop position overlooking the Golden Horn; interior and parapets are compressed for traversal while keeping silhouette.

description_short: Sultan's palace crowns the Seraglio as a stealth infiltration space.
description_full: Palace complex occupies its authentic promontory above the Bosporus; courtyards are tightened but gate sequence follows the real imperial layout.

description_short: Reimagined Library anchors Alexandria's academic quarter.
description_full: Stylized reconstruction placed near the ancient Brucheion district; scale and interiors are speculative but tied to the real scholarly precinct.

description_short: Bayek scales Khufu's pyramid at its precise plateau location.
description_full: Monument is modeled at true position and near-full scale on the Giza plateau, including interior shafts and chambers aligned to real archaeology.

description_short: Hypostyle hall and obelisks form a vast traversal space in Thebes.
description_full: Complex sits where Karnak stands in Luxor; courtyards and pylons are compressed but aligned along the authentic east–west axis of the sanctuary.

name_real: Temple of the Oracle of Amun at Siwa
description_short: Bayek's home sanctuary sits atop Siwa's rock outcrop.
description_full: Ruined oracle temple is set on the true Aghurmi mound with surrounding oasis compressed; architecture mixes reconstructed elements for playability.

description_short: Memphis' Ptah precinct hosts statues and canals in Origins.
description_full: Sanctuary is placed near the Mit Rahina ruins; canals and courts are broadened for quests but keep the sacred enclosure's real-world orientation.

description_short: Stone theater on Athens' south slope hosts dramas and duels.
description_full: Auditorium occupies its true spot on the Acropolis hillside; seating tiers are condensed but stage and backdrop match historic layout.

description_short: Oracle's terrace overlooks the Pleistos valley as in antiquity.
description_full: Terraced sanctuary is set on Mount Parnassus slopes at the authentic site; buildings are restored to classical form with minor scale compression.

description_short: Olympic stadium and temples appear as a compressed festival hub.
description_full: Sacred grove sits at its real location along the Alfeios River; hippodrome and training areas are scaled down but landmarks match archaeology.

description_short: Fortified hill and statue mark Sparta's power center.
description_full: Citadel sits above modern Sparta in its historical position; temples and theatre are reconstructed with condensed spacing for gameplay.

description_short: Labyrinthine palace returns as a myth-tinged ruin on Crete.
description_full: Rebuilt Minoan palace occupies the real hill at Kephala; layout is romanticized with mythic chambers but follows the actual multi-court plan.

description_short: Lion Gate fortress stands atop its real ridge in Odyssey.
description_full: Hilltop citadel matches the authentic acropolis above the Plain of Argos; tombs and walls are slightly compressed but oriented to real approaches.

description_short: Demolished fortress reconstructed as Unity's stormed prison.
description_full: Bastille rises at its historic square; interior courtyards are opened up for missions but towers align with period engravings and true footprint.

description_short: Royal palace appears in Unity expansions with formal gardens.
description_full: Palace complex sits at its real coordinates outside Paris; wings and gardens are truncated yet retain the mirrored layout and Hall of Mirrors axis.

description_short: Neoclassical dome stands over the Latin Quarter in Unity.
description_full: Panthéon is placed on the Montagne Sainte-Geneviève at its real location; interior nave is scaled down but façade proportions stay accurate.

description_short: Royal chapel with soaring glass anchors Île de la Cité paths.
description_full: Gothic chapel sits within the Conciergerie at its historical footprint; upper and lower chapels are merged for gameplay but keep the island setting.

description_short: Royal residence sits behind its gates in Syndicate's Westminster.
description_full: Palace occupies the correct site off The Mall; grounds are trimmed and interiors restricted but façade and courtyard match Victorian layout.

description_short: Big Ben and Parliament rise beside the Thames as a climbing set.
description_full: Neo-Gothic complex sits on the real riverbank; interiors are fictionalized but exterior proportions and clock tower placement follow the true plan.

name_real: Collegiate Church of St Peter at Westminster
description_short: Syndicate's abbey offers rooftops and cloisters by Parliament.
description_full: Gothic church is fixed at its authentic site; nave is condensed to ease traversal but transepts and towers mirror the historic outline.

description_short: Wren's dome becomes a signature leap-of-faith perch in London.
description_full: Cathedral sits at Ludgate Hill as in reality; interior is simplified but dome scale and west front reflect the real Baroque landmark.

description_short: Hadrian's mausoleum serves as the Borgia stronghold in Rome.
description_full: Mausoleum-fortress is placed accurately on the Tiber; interiors and battlements are dramatized but the cylindrical core and bridge approach are true.

description_short: Vatican basilica and square stage Ezio's papal confrontation.
description_full: Basilica rises at its real Vatican site with Bernini's square; nave scale is compressed but dome and colonnades mirror the historical footprint.

description_short: Bridge of shops spans the Arno as a chase route in Florence.
description_full: Medieval bridge sits at its authentic crossing; shop rows are simplified but alignment and span match the real structure over the Arno.

description_short: Wooden Rialto under construction forms a pivotal set piece.
description_full: Bridge is placed across the Grand Canal at its historical market crossing; depicted as scaffolded pre-stone version to fit the 15th-century setting.

description_short: Ezio's villa town appears as a fortified Tuscan hub.
description_full: Walled village matches its real hilltop footprint; interior streets are widened for renovations but towers and gates align to the medieval layout.

description_short: Medieval tower town becomes a vertical playground for assassins.
description_full: Town sits amid Tuscan hills near its real coordinates; tower count is reduced but main squares and walls follow the authentic plan.

description_short: Assassin fortress crowns its real crag above the Syrian plain.
description_full: Citadel occupies the authentic limestone spur; interior halls are fictionalized but curtain walls and gate path follow the historical mountaintop layout.

description_short: Mirage recreates Baghdad's circular core around the caliphal palace.
description_full: Central palace district is a stylized analog of the vanished Round City; radius is compressed yet follows the real concentric ring layout on the Tigris bank.

description_short: Scholarly complex hosts translation halls in Mirage's Baghdad.
description_full: Library is placed near the historical Karkh district; building massing is speculative but tied to the real scholarly quarter south of the palace ring.

description_short: Legendary Assassin stronghold returns as a mountainous fortress.
description_full: Castle sits on its true rock pinnacle in the Alborz range; interiors are dramatized but switchbacks and terraces echo the real Nizari citadel remains.

description_short: Valhalla features stretches of the Roman wall across Northumbria.
description_full: Linear fortification follows the real east–west alignment; forts are compressed but wall segments are placed along authentic ridgelines.

description_short: Tidal abbey island appears during Valhalla's Francia journey.
description_full: Island monastery matches its real bay location; approach causeway and village tiers are simplified but keep the stacked abbey profile.

description_short: Eivor visits the Norse camp at Vinland's UNESCO site.
description_full: Settlement is placed on Newfoundland's northern tip at the real archaeological park; structures are simplified longhouses reflecting the historic remains.

description_short: Clifftop temple at Cape Sounion marks a vista and quest site.
description_full: Sanctuary crowns the real promontory above the Aegean; colonnade is restored to classical form with slight scale reduction for gameplay space.

description_short: Delos appears with its terraces and lion-lined sacred way.
description_full: Island sanctuary is mapped at its real Aegean coordinates; statues and temples are condensed but follow the authentic port and terrace layout.

description_short: Decorated hypostyle halls feature in a desert-side pilgrimage stop.
description_full: Temple sits on the west bank of the Nile at its true site; courts are scaled down but zodiac ceiling motifs and enclosure orientation match reality.

description_short: French Quarter cathedral fronts Jackson Square in Liberation.
description_full: Cathedral sits on its genuine Chartres Street frontage; square is compressed but façade and triple spires mirror the real colonial landmark.

description_short: French coastal stronghold appears during Shay's naval missions.
description_full: Fortress is placed on Cape Breton Island at its historic harbor; bastions are simplified for naval assaults but follow the real seaward outline.

description_short: Hidden Templar city repurposes Cappadocia's subterranean tunnels.
description_full: Derinkuyu's real underground complex inspires this level; layout is a composite of multiple caves but entrance placement reflects the actual town site.

description_short: Tall spire dominates the southern Manhattan skyline in AC3.
description_full: Church stands at Broadway and Wall Street as in history; churchyard and nave are shrunken but the spire orientation and footprint remain true.

description_short: Continental Congress hall anchors Philadelphia missions.
description_full: Georgian state house sits on Chestnut Street at its real address; interior chambers are simplified but tower and wings match the historic plan.

description_short: Connor fights across the slopes of the Charlestown battlefield.
description_full: Battlefield sits at its historical position overlooking the Mystic; monument is anachronistically present as a placeholder but terrain matches the ridge.

description_short: Opening skirmish of the Revolution plays out on the village green.
description_full: Common is placed in its true crossroads location; surrounding houses are compressed but the triangular green mirrors the real colonial layout.

description_short: Winter camp with log huts rests along the Schuylkill in AC3.
description_full: Encampment is mapped to the real plateau west of the river; hut layouts are stylized but the ridge and river orientation follow the historic park.

description_short: Sunken pirate haven reimagined as a bustling port in Black Flag.
description_full: Town sits on the Palisadoes spit at its real coordinates; shorelines are rebuilt pre-earthquake with condensed streets suited to ship missions.

description_short: Pirate republic capital sits on New Providence's real harbor.
description_full: Settlement uses the authentic harbor mouth and sandbars; streets are broadened for gameplay but fort and bay orientation mirror the real geography.

description_short: Colonial Kingston appears as a major hub beneath the Blue Mountains.
description_full: City is set on its real south-shore grid; districts are compressed but harbor placement and mountainous backdrop reflect the actual setting.

description_short: Walled cliffside ruins host a hidden Assassins outpost in AC4.
description_full: Site sits on the Caribbean bluff at its real coordinates; temple groupings are intact but scaled down to fit the playable cove and jungle approaches.

description_short: Valhalla's Dyflin mirrors Dublin's Norse trading hub on the Liffey.
description_full: Harbor walls and longphorts sit on the real River Liffey bend; street plan is simplified into broad market lanes but anchored to Dublin's historic core.

description_short: Seat of Irish high kings appears as a ritual mound above Meath.
description_full: Ringforts crown the true Tara ridge; monuments are compressed together for gameplay while preserving the hill's distinctive oval earthworks.

description_short: Hexagonal basalt columns jut from Valhalla's northern shoreline.
description_full: Rocky stepping stones match the real UNESCO site; surrounding cliffs are simplified but coastline orientation matches Antrim's headland.

description_short: Beehive huts crown the sea stack monastery off Ireland's coast.
description_full: Island silhouette and terraced huts follow Skellig Michael's summit; stair routes are widened and landing coves added to host raids.

description_short: Fortified chapel complex sits atop the limestone outcrop of Cashel.
description_full: Valhalla places the royal enclosure on the real rock plateau; towers and halls are merged but the cliffside height and surrounding plain match the site.

description_short: Tidal abbey island rises from the bay in Siege of Paris content.
description_full: Rocky mount with encircling village follows the real tidal islet; cloisters and walls are condensed to speed traversal but keep the stepped climb.

description_short: Royal necropolis north of Paris anchors a major Siege of Paris raid.
description_full: Gothic choir and twin-towered facade mirror the true basilica footprint; surrounding town is compressed but the abbey's position along the Seine is accurate.

description_short: River island town along the Seine serves as a Siege of Paris stronghold.
description_full: Settlement sits on the Seine islet at Melun's real location; bridges and keep are scaled down but river orientation and bend match the modern city.

description_short: Left Bank abbey appears as a fortified Parisian district in Valhalla.
description_full: Monastery grounds occupy their historic parcel on the Seine's south bank; cloisters are simplified but the Romanesque tower placement mirrors the real abbey.

description_short: Eivor visits the great cathedral of Canterbury in Valhalla's Kent arc.
description_full: Cathedral stands on its authentic hilltop close to the city walls; nave and cloisters are truncated but altar orientation and town layout match the real site.

description_short: Bright chalk cliffs guard the Kentish coast at Valhalla's edge.
description_full: Sea-facing chalk walls sit at their real coastal stretch; fortifications are fictional, but cliff height, shoreline curve, and sightlines to the Channel are true.

description_short: Hilltop Lincoln Cathedral crowns Eivor's Mercian alliance quest.
description_full: Cathedral occupies the real Norman ridge inside Lincoln's walls; transepts are compressed but the steep climb and castle-adjacent close mirror the city.

description_short: University town appears as a fortified river crossing in Valhalla.
description_full: Settlement straddles the Thames at Oxford's real ford; colleges are anachronistic, but street grid and castle mound mirror the historic core.

description_short: Isle of Ely's towering cathedral rises from the marshes in Valhalla.
description_full: Ely sits on its elevated island amid the Fens; nave and octagon are simplified, but the promontory setting and surrounding wetlands align to the real landscape.

description_short: Megalithic Stonehenge serves as a standing stone mystery for Eivor.
description_full: Stone circle sits on Salisbury Plain at its true site; outer banks and nearby cursus are reduced for space, but trilithon layout matches the real monument.

description_short: Abbey at Verulamium features in Valhalla's Mercian routes.
description_full: Cathedral rises on its hilltop outside Roman walls at the real St Albans site; nave is shortened but tower placement and surrounding ruins mirror the location.

description_short: Clifftop fortress at Bamburgh anchors Valhalla's northern coast.
description_full: Castle occupies its real basalt outcrop above the North Sea; curtain walls and keep are condensed, yet the promontory shape and beach access follow reality.

description_short: Valhalla portrays Nottingham as a fortified river town in Mercia.
description_full: Town sits on the River Trent near the real settlement; castle mound and market square are simplified but align with Nottingham's historic hill and crossing.

description_short: Hidden Ones expansion sends Bayek to the remote monastery on Sinai.
description_full: Walled basilica and library sit at the base of the real Mount Sinai massif; paths are shortened for play but oasis setting and enclosure match the UNESCO site.

description_short: Underground Apis bull catacombs lie beneath Saqqara's plateau.
description_full: Origins places the hypogea under the Saqqara escarpment at their real location; tunnels are widened and condensed but follow the necropolis alignment.

description_short: Painted hypostyle halls of Dendera appear in Origins' Nile travels.
description_full: Complex stands on the west bank at its real position; roof reliefs and pronaos are intact though shrunk to match the explorable precinct.

description_short: Twin temples to Sobek and Horus sit on the Nile bend in Origins.
description_full: Sanctuary rests on its riverside rise north of Aswan; courts are compressed but dual-axis design and cliffside vantage mirror the historical layout.

description_short: Colossal seated statues guard the cliff-cut temple south of Aswan.
description_full: Origins places the rock temple at its real lakeside site; surrounding terrain is smoothed but facade scale and axis toward the Nile mirror the monument.

name_real: Pyramid of Amenemhat III at Hawara
description_short: Ruined Hawara pyramid and labyrinth appear near Lake Moeris.
description_full: Site is placed on the desert edge south of modern Hawara; labyrinth interior is fictional, but pyramid footprint and nearby canal align with the archaeology.

description_short: Odyssey features the citadel of Mycenae with its famed Lion Gate.
description_full: Hilltop palace walls sit on the true acropolis above the Argolid plain; gate and tholos tombs are scaled for traversal but follow Mycenae's layout.

description_short: Fortified Acrocorinth towers above Korinth in Odyssey's Peloponnese.
description_full: Citadel crowns the real limestone monolith; walls and temples are condensed but the steep switchbacks and gulf views mirror the historic fortress.

description_short: Perfectly tiered theater hosts cult plays and conspirators in Odyssey.
description_full: Auditorium sits on its authentic hillside; seating count is reduced but stage orientation, skene backdrop, and Asclepius sanctuary context match the site.

description_short: Aegina's hilltop Doric temple overlooks Odyssey's Saronic waters.
description_full: Temple sits on the same crest as the real ruin; columns and cella are intact but scaled down, keeping the island vista and triangular layout of the original.

description_short: Massive marble doorway stands on the harbor islet in Odyssey's Naxos.
description_full: Gateway sits on the real Palatia islet at the harbor mouth; surrounding city is compressed, but the causeway and sea-facing frame match the monument's setting.

description_short: Sanctuary of Hera appears near Samos' coast in Odyssey.
description_full: Temple stands on its low plain by the Imbrasos; columns are partially standing like the ruin today, with the processional road and harbor placement intact.

description_short: Nemean sanctuary hosts athletic quests in Odyssey's Korinthia.
description_full: Ruins sit on the real valley floor; surviving columns and stadium nearby are simplified but positioned to mirror the archaeological park.

description_short: Mycenaean palace above Pylos features in Odyssey's southwest coast.
description_full: Hilltop complex overlooks Navarino Bay at the real Ano Englianos site; megaron and storerooms are reconstructed but match the footprint of excavated walls.

description_short: Odyssey recreates Messene's long stadium and colonnades.
description_full: Stadium sits adjacent to the theatre on the real Messene grid; seating is reduced but the elongated track and flanking stoas mirror the archaeological park.

description_short: Oracle of the dead stands above the Acheron marshlands in Odyssey.
description_full: Sanctuary is placed on the hill above the confluence of the Acheron and Phlegethon; subterranean halls are exaggerated but sit on the real ruin footprint.

description_short: Sparta's looming Mount Taygetos hosts mythic leaps in Odyssey.
description_full: Peak sits at the real summit above Sparta; slopes are tightened for climbing, but the jagged ridge line and view over the Eurotas valley follow reality.

description_short: The Hot Gates battlefield opens Odyssey's tutorial flashback.
description_full: Narrow coastal pass lies along the Malian Gulf at its real location; shoreline has receded historically, but the game mirrors the straitened corridor and hill.

description_short: Harbor twin bays of Knidos appear on Odyssey's Carian coast.
description_full: City sits on the Datça peninsula tip like the real ruins; theatre and temples are restored but compressed, keeping the dual harbor layout accurate.

description_short: Chronicles: China has Shao Jun infiltrate Beijing's imperial palace.
description_full: Palace sits inside Beijing's inner city walls; halls and courtyards are simplified side-scrolling spaces but mirror the north-south axis of the real complex.

description_short: Chronicles depicts Mutianyu's ridgeline wall segment for platforming.
description_full: Wall clings to the mountains northeast of Beijing at Mutianyu; tower spacing is compressed but the serpentine ridge and forested slopes match the real section.

description_short: Shaolin Monastery serves as a refuge and training ground in Chronicles.
description_full: Temple complex lies on Songshan's slopes at its real site; pagodas and training yards are stylized 2.5D spaces but keep the mountain backdrop and layout cues.

description_short: Chronicles: India opens with the towering sandstone walls of Delhi's Red Fort.
description_full: Fort stands along the Yamuna at its true footprint; inner courts are flattened for side-scrolling, yet the Lahori Gate approach and river-facing ramparts remain aligned.

description_short: Marble mausoleum appears in Chronicles: India as a backdrop for stealth.
description_full: Game recreates the riverside gardens and iconic tomb on the Yamuna; charbagh layout is compressed but dome and minaret silhouettes mirror the real monument.

description_short: Clifftop Gwalior Fort forms a multi-tiered infiltration set in Chronicles.
description_full: Fort sits on its sandstone plateau above the city; palaces and temples are stacked for traversal but keep the sheer rock face and skyline footprint of the real site.

description_short: Chronicles: Russia stages a Bolshevik siege at the Winter Palace.
description_full: Palace sits on the Neva embankment at its real address; interiors are linearized for side-scrolling, but facade scale and Palace Square orientation remain faithful.

description_short: Chronicles finale infiltrates the fortified Moscow Kremlin complex.
description_full: Red brick walls and cathedrals occupy their real quadrilateral; towers are simplified but Spasskaya Gate and riverside orientation match the historic fortress.

description_short: Rogue charts the harbor town of St. John's on Newfoundland's coast.
description_full: Town sits on the Atlantic harbor at its true coordinates; fortifications are heightened for naval gameplay but harbor shape and Signal Hill match reality.

description_short: Clifftop Quebec City overlooks the St. Lawrence in Rogue's campaign.
description_full: Upper and Lower Towns occupy the real promontory; citadel and port are compressed but keep the steep escarpment and river bend of the historic city.

description_short: Walled French stronghold at Louisbourg appears in Rogue naval missions.
description_full: Fortress sits on Cape Breton's harbor mouth at its historical location; bastions are simplified but the harbor, spit, and island batteries mirror the real layout.

description_short: Rogue visits the nascent British naval base at Halifax Harbour.
description_full: Settlement sits on Chebucto Bay at the real harbor; fortifications are early and simplified, but the twin peninsulas and harbor mouth align with geography.

description_short: AC3 depicts the French frontier fort where the Seven Years' War sparks.
description_full: Fort sits at the forks of the Ohio where Pittsburgh stands today; ramparts are simplified but the peninsula layout and river meeting point mirror the historic site.

description_short: Origins lets Bayek climb the Step Pyramid rising from Saqqara's desert.
description_full: The six-tiered pyramid stands on Saqqara's escarpment at its true coordinates; block scale is adjusted for traversal, but the stepped silhouette and surrounding mastabas follow the real complex.

description_short: Origins DLC adds the Roman trade port of Berenice on the Red Sea.
description_full: Harbor lies on the real Ababda coast where Berenice once handled Indo-Roman trade; quays and warehouses are compressed, yet the bay orientation mirrors the archaeological site.

description_short: Origins charts rock-cut tomb entrances along the Valley of the Queens.
description_full: The necropolis sits southwest of Luxor at its real wadis; tombs are spaced for gameplay but align with the valley mouths and cliff faces of the historic burial ground.

description_short: Desert side quests send Bayek to the Achaemenid-era Hibis Temple.
description_full: Temple stands in Kharga Oasis where Hibis remains today; columns and hypostyle halls are simplified but the mudbrick enclosure and western desert backdrop match the site.

description_short: Origins scatters broken pylons across the mudflats of Tanis in the Delta.
description_full: The ruined capital sits on its real tell between Nile branches; obelisks and sarcophagi are condensed, yet the raised mounds and surrounding canals trace the archaeological plan.

description_short: Origins features the hypostyle hall at Esna as a puzzle-filled shrine.
description_full: The Khnum temple appears along the Nile at its real town site; roof height and reliefs are compressed, but the column forest and adjacent quay align with the modern location.

description_short: Ramesses III's mortuary temple hosts combat arenas in Origins.
description_full: Complex sits against the cliffs at its Luxor coordinates; pylons and courts are slightly shrunk but mirror the orthogonal plan and painted reliefs of the New Kingdom monument.

description_short: Origins DLC visits the clustered Nubian pyramids at Meroe.
description_full: Tombs rise on the desert ridges northeast of Shendi at the real royal cemetery; pyramid spacing is tightened but the orientation and sandstone forms follow the archaeological layout.

description_short: Mirage includes the canal town of Ukbara north of Baghdad.
description_full: Settlement sits on the Tigris floodplain where Ukbara historically lay; waterworks and gardens are condensed, yet the river bend placement matches the real location.

description_short: Mirage references the ruined caliphal palace complex at Samarra.
description_full: The palace footprint appears on the Tigris bank where Jawsaq stood; courtyards are simplified ruins but the axial layout and location north of Baghdad echo the historic site.

description_short: Mirage lore notes Mosul on the Tigris as a northern trade hub.
description_full: City appears on maps at its real Tigris crossing; in-game depiction is compressed and largely referenced via travel notes, yet its placement relative to Baghdad matches reality.

description_short: Mirage nods toward the mountain fortress of Alamut in Assassin lore.
description_full: Castle is referenced west of Tehran where the real stronghold crowns a ridge; only briefly seen, but the placement in the Elburz foothills mirrors the historic Assassin seat.

description_short: Ezio infiltrates a Templar stronghold in Cappadocia's underground city.
description_full: The warren of halls sits beneath the Cappadocian plateau where Kaymakli's tunnels exist; chambers are expanded for navigation, yet volcanic tuff corridors and ventilation shafts match the real site.

description_short: Revelations features the palace arsenal along the Golden Horn.
description_full: Workshops line the sea walls on the peninsula where the Ottoman arsenal operated; building count is trimmed, but the shoreline siting between palace and shipyard tracks the real complex.

description_short: Revelations sends couriers through the walled heights of Bursa.
description_full: Hilltop fortress sits south of the Marmara at its real ridge; gatehouses and mosques are simplified, yet the stepped walls and view toward Uludağ mirror Bursa's old citadel.

description_short: Odyssey marks the Spartan sanctuary of Amyklai south of Sparta.
description_full: Sanctuary sits near modern Amykles on its hill; the colossal throne monument is reconstructed for gameplay, but the countryside placement and river nearby reflect the historic site.

description_short: Odyssey recreates the mountain-top altar of Zeus on Mount Lykaon.
description_full: Peak shrine sits in central Arcadia at its real summit; trails are dramatized for climbing, but the ash altar and twin peaks mirror the historic sanctuary's position.

description_short: Odyssey highlights the narrow Euripus Strait crossing at Chalcis.
description_full: Bridge spans the tidal strait between Euboea and mainland at the real chokepoint; structure is simplified but the channel's narrow width and city placement match geography.

description_short: Odyssey maps the hilltop acropolis of Larissa in Thessaly.
description_full: City is placed on the Peneus River plain at its true coordinates; walls and theater are compressed, yet the acropolis mound and river loop mirror the real Larissa layout.

description_short: Northern Odyssey quests visit the coastal polis of Abdera.
description_full: Town sits on the Thracian shore near modern Avdira; fortifications are rebuilt for missions, but the harbor bay and island-dotted coast align with the archaeological site.

name_real: Sanctuary of the Great Gods, Samothrace
description_short: Odyssey depicts the mystery cult terraces on Samothrace's slopes.
description_full: Sanctuary is perched on the island's north slopes where the ruins stand; terraces are compacted but the stream, theater, and monumental precinct match the real layout.

description_short: Valhalla river raids target the tidal monastery at Lindisfarne.
description_full: Island monastery sits off the Northumberland coast at its true tidal flats; abbey ruins and priory are condensed, yet the causeway and harbor match the real Holy Island setting.

description_short: Valhalla lets Eivor scale segments of Hadrian's Wall in Northumbria.
description_full: Stone rampart runs east-west across the moors at its real line; forts are compressed to single keeps, but the ditch, turrets, and crags follow the Housesteads stretch of the wall.

description_short: Valhalla situates Alfred's seat beside the great church at Winchester.
description_full: Cathedral complex sits along the River Itchen at its real location; nave scale is reduced but the close, city walls, and palace adjacency mirror Anglo-Saxon Winchester.

description_short: Valhalla's northern shires include the oaks and clearings of Sherwood.
description_full: The woodland lies north of Nottingham at its real extent; trees and camps are gamified, but the rolling heathland and proximity to the River Trent reflect the historic royal forest.

description_short: Wrath of the Druids DLC rebuilds the Norse trading town of Dublin.
description_full: Settlement sits on the River Liffey where Dublin grew; ramparts and quays are condensed, yet the longphort harbor, Thing square, and Christchurch ridge match the historical core.

description_short: Valhalla's Ireland DLC features the basalt columns of the Giant's Causeway.
description_full: Hexagonal basalt stacks rise on Antrim's coast at their real headland; scale is slightly reduced for traversal, but the cliffside amphitheater shape mirrors the UNESCO site.

description_short: Siege of Paris DLC blocks the Seine with the fortified bridge at Pont-de-l'Arche.
description_full: Bridge-fort sits on the Eure-Seine confluence at its authentic choke point; towers are enlarged for assaults, yet the island placement and twin abutments follow medieval defenses.

description_short: Siege of Paris DLC includes the riverfront abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés.
description_full: Monastery lies on the Left Bank where the real abbey stood; cloister and tower are simplified, but the placement beside the Seine and surrounding suburbia mirror its historic footprint.

description_short: Unity renders the revolutionary execution ground at Place de la Concorde.
description_full: Square spans the Seine edge where Louis XV Place stood; guillotine staging is dramatized, but the bridging axes to Tuileries and Champs-Élysées trace the real Parisian layout.

description_short: Unity stages riots on the square of Paris's Hôtel de Ville.
description_full: City hall fronts the Seine at its real coordinates; facade reflects the 18th-century design, and the plaza orientation toward the river matches the historic civic center.

description_short: Unity maps the arcaded gardens of the Palais-Royal as a social hub.
description_full: Palace complex sits north of the Louvre at its real block; gardens and galleries are slightly compressed but retain the rectangular layout and colonnades of the historic site.

description_short: Unity features the dual-towered Saint-Sulpice on Paris's Left Bank.
description_full: The basilica rises over its plaza at the real Rue Bonaparte site; interiors are simplified for parkour, yet the nave scale, twin towers, and fountain align with the historic church.

description_short: Syndicate includes the arched train sheds of King's Cross Station.
description_full: Station sits on the Euston Road where it stands today; concourses are tightened for gameplay, but the twin arched roofs and clock tower frontage mirror the Victorian terminus.

description_short: Syndicate showcases the Gothic Revival Houses of Parliament along the Thames.
description_full: Complex occupies its true riverbank footprint; interiors are curtailed, but Big Ben's tower, river terrace, and courtyard arrangement reflect the real Westminster palace.

description_short: Syndicate opens the neoclassical British Museum for rooftop infiltrations.
description_full: Museum sits on Great Russell Street at its real site; galleries are truncated for missions, but the portico, courtyard, and Bloomsbury street grid match the historic layout.

name_real: St Pancras Renaissance Hotel and Station
description_short: Syndicate models the red-brick St. Pancras frontage beside the rail yards.
description_full: The Gothic hotel and train shed occupy their real corner near Euston Road; interiors are limited, but the soaring clock tower and arched canopy mirror the Victorian landmark.

description_short: Syndicate's borough map includes the iron-and-glass halls of Covent Garden.
description_full: Market sits between the Strand and Holborn at its real piazza; stalls are compressed but the arched roof, surrounding arcades, and proximity to the theater district reflect reality.

description_short: Liberation centers its New Orleans skyline on St. Louis Cathedral at Jackson Square.
description_full: Cathedral fronts the Mississippi at its real French Quarter site; spires and plaza are slightly compressed, but the tri-steeple facade and flanking Cabildo match the historic square.

description_short: Black Flag and Freedom Cry visit the colonial port of Cap-Français.
description_full: Port city sits on the bay north of Haiti where Cap-Haïtien stands; street grid is compacted, yet the harbor, fort, and mountain backdrop mirror the historic Saint-Domingue capital.

description_short: Black Flag charts the walled Caribbean bastion of Cartagena.
description_full: City sits on its Caribbean bay with fortified walls and Bocagrande peninsula; bastions are simplified, yet the harbor mouth and stone ramparts mirror the UNESCO-listed old city.

description_short: Black Flag includes the southeastern Cuban port of Santiago as a trading town.
description_full: Town hugs the bay beneath the Sierra Maestra at its real coordinates; streets are compressed, but the harbor curve and coastal fortifications reflect the colonial settlement.

description_short: Naval contracts mention Bridgetown's harbor in Black Flag's Caribbean map.
description_full: Harbor city sits on Carlisle Bay at its real position; in-game depiction is brief and compressed to docks, but the bay orientation and peninsula match the Barbadian capital.

description_short: Black Flag charts San Juan's harbor as a Spanish trade stop.
description_full: City lies on its Atlantic islet connected by bridges; Castillo walls are simplified, yet the harbor mouth and lagoon setting mirror the real colonial capital of Puerto Rico.

description_short: Black Flag's map nods to the fortified Gulf port of Campeche.
description_full: Town is placed on the Bay of Campeche at its real coordinates; bastions are minimal in-game, but the polygonal walls and coastal angle reflect the Spanish fortified layout.

description_short: Black Flag charts Basse-Terre as a French-held sugar island harbor.
description_full: Settlement sits on Guadeloupe's western flank at its real harbor; fort and streets are compressed, yet the mountainous backdrop and bay placement match the Caribbean town.

description_short: Chronicles: China finale storms the hilltop Fortaleza do Monte in Macau.
description_full: Fort crowns the Macau peninsula at its real hill; ramparts are linearized for 2.5D traversal, but the commanding view over the port and triangular bastions mirror the historic stronghold.

description_short: Chronicles: India sneaks through the stepped courtyards of Amer Fort.
description_full: Fort sits on the Aravalli slopes above Maota Lake at its real site; courtyards are flattened for platforming, yet the zigzag ascent and lakefront mirroring the Rajput palace remain.

description_short: Chronicles: India references the Mughal Lahore Fort amid Sikh conflicts.
description_full: Citadel lies north of the Walled City at its true footprint; representation is brief and compressed, but the Sheesh Mahal terraces and gate axes echo the historic fort complex.

description_short: Chronicles: Russia features the revolutionary headquarters at Smolny Institute.
description_full: Neoclassical complex stands on the Okhta bank at its real address; interiors are side-scrolling corridors, yet the twin-towered cathedral backdrop and riverfront placement mirror the site.

description_short: Valhalla renders Northwic as the Norse-held town of Norwich in East Anglia.
description_full: Settlement sits on the River Wensum where Norwich grew; ramparts and stilted docks are compressed, yet the street grid and cathedral mound mirror the early medieval port.

description_short: Eivor besieges Colcestre, Valhalla's take on Colchester in Essexe.
description_full: Fortified town sits on its Roman-era hill above the Colne; walls and forum are shrunk for traversal, yet Balkerne Gate and the castle keep mark the true core of Colchester.

description_short: Valhalla portrays Cisseceaster as a Saxon port at modern Chichester.
description_full: Town lies on the coastal plain west of the South Downs at its real site; market lanes and churchyards are simplified but align to Chichester's Roman grid and harbor approach.

description_short: Repton serves as the Great Heathen Army's riverside camp in Valhalla.
description_full: Encampment sits on the River Trent bend where the Viking Great Army over-wintered; mound and churchyard match the real monastery grounds, though fortifications are expanded for play.

description_short: Eivor assaults Tamworth, Offa's former seat on the River Tame.
description_full: Hilltop burh rises at the confluence of the Tame and Anker where Tamworth Castle stands today; palisades and halls are compressed but oriented to the historic royal enclosure.

description_short: Valhalla reuses Roman walls to frame the Saxon town of Chester.
description_full: City sits on the River Dee at its authentic site; amphitheater ruins and grid streets echo the Roman fortress plan, albeit compressed into a smaller, climbable core.

description_short: Glowecestre appears as a festival town along the Severn in Valhalla.
description_full: Settlement sits on the east bank of the River Severn matching Gloucester's site; timber halls and druidic mounds compress the real Roman grid and cathedral close into a small hub.

description_short: Eivor visits Exeter's fortified burh on the River Exe.
description_full: Town occupies the real ridge above the Exe; walls and gatehouses are shrunk for traversal, yet the cathedral green and quay sit where medieval Exeter developed.

description_short: Valhalla crowns the coastal headland of Bamburgh with its fortress hall.
description_full: Stronghold occupies the same Whin Sill promontory as the real Bamburgh Castle; curtain walls are simplified but the cliffside approach and keep placement mirror the site.

description_short: Cathedral hill of Dunholm anchors Valhalla's Durham arc.
description_full: Town sits on the River Wear peninsula where Durham stands; cathedral and castle are foreshortened to fit the ridge, yet the looping river gorge and bridgeheads match reality.

description_short: Wrath of the Druids marks the ceremonial Hill of Tara in Meath.
description_full: Sacred hill sits exactly on its ridge above the Boyne valley; raths and earthworks are simplified circles, but the axial approach and summit mounds follow the archaeological site.

description_short: Stone ringfort of Aileach overlooks Lough Swilly in Valhalla's Ireland.
description_full: Hillfort crowns the same summit west of Derry; concentric walls are opened for combat and interior tiers flattened, yet its view over the loughs matches the real monument.

description_short: Valhalla visits the ruined monastic city of Clonmacnoise on the Shannon.
description_full: Round towers and high crosses stand on the true boggy terrace above the River Shannon; cloisters are condensed for navigation but aligned to the real cathedral ruins.

description_short: Eivor helps safeguard the scriptorium at Kells in Wrath of the Druids.
description_full: Abbey sits within its true enclosure north of the Blackwater; church and round tower are simplified but preserve the layout of the famous monastic site.

description_short: Wrath of the Druids references Armagh's hilltop ecclesiastical seat.
description_full: Settlement occupies the twin hillocks where Armagh grew around its cathedral; walls and courts are compressed, but the ridge-top layout mirrors the historical religious center.

description_short: Siege of Paris DLC sends Eivor to the Seine stronghold at Melun.
description_full: Island citadel sits on the Seine bend at the real town of Melun; bridgeheads and ramparts are condensed but placed on the historic river islands guarding the approach to Paris.

description_short: Eivor passes Chartres and its hilltop church on the road to Paris.
description_full: City appears as a compressed hill settlement on its true Beauce plateau; the cathedral mass crowns the ridge where the real Notre-Dame de Chartres stands, albeit at smaller scale.

description_short: Reims is referenced as a royal coronation seat in Valhalla's Francia.
description_full: Location sits on the Vesle plain where Reims lies; cathedral spires are simplified silhouettes, used as map landmarks rather than full interiors, but anchored to the correct hilltop.

description_short: Unity lets Arno scale the neoclassical Panthéon on Paris's Left Bank.
description_full: Monument stands on the Montagne Sainte-Geneviève at its true site; interior is simplified but the dome, portico, and plaza orientation match the 18th-century landmark.

description_short: Unity opens the gardens and façades of the Palais du Luxembourg.
description_full: Palace grounds lie on their real Left Bank block; wings are shortened and garden parterres simplified, yet the footprint and central dome mirror the historical Luxembourg estate.

description_short: Unity recreates the octagonal Place Vendôme with its columned square.
description_full: Square sits north of the Tuileries at its real coordinates; façades are slightly compressed but maintain the uniform arcades and central column footprint of the historic plaza.

description_short: Arno stalks targets through the courtyards of the Palais-Royal in Unity.
description_full: Complex occupies its true block north of the Louvre; arcades and gardens are simplified, yet the double courtyards and theater wing align with the historic palace layout.

description_short: Odyssey features the siege-worn town of Potidaia on the Pallene isthmus.
description_full: Settlement sits on the narrow neck of the Kassandra peninsula at its real site; walls and harbors are compressed but mirror the dual-coast position of classical Potidaia.

description_short: Amphipolis appears as a fortified Strymon River town in Odyssey.
description_full: City occupies the true loop of the Strymon; walls and wooden docks are reduced, yet the hilltop acropolis and riverside theatre align with the archaeological site.

description_short: Odyssey's island arc visits Mytilene, capital of Lesbos.
description_full: Harbor town wraps around the southeastern peninsula of Lesbos at its real location; twin ports and acropolis ridge are simplified but oriented like historic Mytilene.

description_short: Chios City serves as a mastico harbor in Odyssey's eastern Aegean.
description_full: Town hugs the east coast of Chios where the modern capital stands; shipyards and walls are condensed, yet the promontory harbor and hilltop keep match the real setting.

description_short: Odyssey's family arc returns to Naxos City in the central Cyclades.
description_full: Harbor lies on the northwest coast where modern Naxos Town sits; the Portara causeway and hillside streets are shortened but match the real island capital's layout.

description_short: Thera's volcanic caldera hosts an Atlantis gateway in Odyssey.
description_full: Island ring is placed at Santorini's real caldera; cliffs and Akrotiri ruins are condensed for traversal, and the mythic gateway is fictional but anchored to the southern cape.

description_short: Odyssey climbs the terraced Asklepieion sanctuary on Kos.
description_full: Healing complex sits on its hillside west of modern Kos town; terraces are merged for gameplay, yet the temple alignment and sea views mirror the real archaeological site.

description_short: Legacy of the First Blade brings Kassandra to Rhodes' harbor city.
description_full: Port occupies the northeast tip of Rhodes at its true location; walls and colossus references are stylized, but the twin harbors and acropolis ridge match the historic town.

description_short: Odyssey features the oak oracle of Dodona in Epirus.
description_full: Sanctuary sits in the Tomaros foothills at its real meadow; theater and sacred oak are compressed into a small complex, keeping the valley orientation of the historic site.

description_short: Nicopolis appears as a Roman-founded port on Odyssey's western shore.
description_full: City sits on the Preveza peninsula at its historic site; walls and forum are downsized, but the twin harbors and ridge-top acropolis reflect the real Augustan foundation.

description_short: Odyssey's western sailings reach Taras, the Spartan colony at Taranto.
description_full: Harbor city sits on its natural inlet at the heel of Italy; acropolis and docks are simplified but positioned on the peninsula where ancient Taras thrived.

description_short: Syracuse is featured as a fortified Sicilian harbor in Odyssey content.
description_full: City occupies Ortigia Island at its true site; harbors and Greek theatre are compressed, yet the island causeway and coastal walls mirror classical Syracuse.

description_short: Odyssey portrays Gortyn as a Cretan capital split by the Lethaios stream.
description_full: City sits on the Mesara plain at its real ruins; the odeon and plane tree square are simplified, but the river divide and southern acropolis follow the archaeological layout.

description_short: Labyrinthine Knossos hosts minotaur myths in Odyssey's Crete arc.
description_full: Palace sits on the Kephala hill where Knossos stands; multi-level wings are compressed and mythologized, yet the central court and processional axes mirror the real complex.

description_short: Odyssey includes the stepped courts of Phaistos on Crete's south coast.
description_full: Ruins lie on the low hill above the Messara plain at their real site; wings are merged for traversal, but the central court orientation and valley views match Phaistos.

description_short: Odyssey shows Kydonia as a harbor polis on Crete's north shore.
description_full: Town occupies the bay where modern Chania stands; harbor walls and agora are simplified, yet the peninsula harbor and inland hills reflect the real Kydonia setting.

description_short: Origins depicts Naucratis as a bustling Greek trading port in the Delta.
description_full: City sits on the Canopic branch of the Nile near its historical site; docks and temples are compressed but aligned to the river bend where Naucratis prospered.

description_short: Bayek aids the crocodile cult town of Krokodilopolis in Origins.
description_full: Settlement lies on the Faiyum's north shore where Arsinoe stood; canals and arena are condensed, yet the lakefront orientation and temple mound mirror the real site.

description_short: Oxyrhynchus appears as a papyrus-rich canal city in Origins.
description_full: Town follows the Bahr Yussef canal at its true location; streets are narrowed for traversal, but the riverside quays and theatre mound align with the historic settlement.

description_short: Origins' westward quests reach the coastal port of Paraetonium.
description_full: Harbor sits on the Mediterranean bay where modern Matruh lies; breakwaters and forums are simplified, yet the crescent harbor and desert backdrop match ancient Paraetonium.

description_short: Origins includes the resort village of Canopus east of Alexandria.
description_full: Village sits on the Abu Qir coast at its historical location; canals and villas are compressed seaside retreats, anchored to the peninsula where Canopus once faced the Mediterranean.

description_short: Submerged Heracleion is explored as underwater ruins in Origins.
description_full: Dive site lies off the Abu Qir Bay where Heracleion's remains sit today; temples and statues are rearranged for gameplay but correspond to the real submerged city grid.

description_short: Origins features Cyrene's temples and theater on the Libyan plateau.
description_full: City crowns the Jebel Akhdar escarpment at its true site; theater and agora are compressed for navigation, yet the cliffside orientation and spring-fed valley match reality.

description_short: Apollonia serves as Cyrene's coastal harbor in Origins.
description_full: Port occupies the real bay at Marsa Susa; breakwaters and lighthouse are reduced, yet the triple-cove shoreline and uphill road to Cyrene mirror the ancient harbor town.

description_short: Miletos appears as an Ionian port with grand harbors in Odyssey.
description_full: City lies at the mouth of the Meander where Miletus stood; harbors and theatre are condensed, but the peninsula layout and Sacred Way align with the historical polis.

description_short: Odyssey nods to the hilltop acropolis of Pergamon in Mysia.
description_full: Acropolis rises above the Caicus plain at its real Bergama site; terraces are simplified but the steep theater slope and altar plateau reflect the ancient city's layout.

description_short: Odyssey references the sanctuary city of Ephesos on the Aegean coast.
description_full: City sits in the Kaystros valley at its true site; harbor is silted and stylized, but the Artemision precinct and theater-agora axis align with the archaeological plan.

description_short: Odyssey includes the harbor of Pythagoreion on the island of Samos.
description_full: Town sits on Samos' south coast where the ancient port of Tigani lay; harbor moles and hillside streets are compressed, yet the tunnel mouth and quay line match the Pythagoreion site.
